block.p: American League SEATTLE MARINERS--Activated SS Alex Rodriguez from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned OF Charles Gipson to Tacoma of the PCL.
American League SEATTLE MARINERS--Activated SS Alex Rodriguez from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned OF Charles Gipson to Tacoma of the PCL.
Women's National Basketball Association DETROIT SHOCK--Activated F Olympia Scott-Richardson from the injured list. Waived G Madinah Slaise.

National Football League ATLANTA FALCONS--Signed G Everett McIver. Waived G Alex Bernstein. CAROLINA PANTHERS--Agreed to terms with DT Eric Swann on a one-year contract. GREEN BAY PACKERS--Agreed to terms with OT Chad Clifton on a four-year contract. INDIANAPOLIS COLTS--Signed RB Mark Kacmarynski. Announced the retirement of RB Dan Kendra. PITTSBURGH STEELERS--Signed OL Ryan Thomassie. Released LB Mike Sands. MIAMI DOLPHINS--Signed OT Todd Wade and CB Ben Kelly to multiyear contracts. MINNESOTA VIKINGS--Signed DL Chris Hovan. ST. LOUIS RAMS--Signed DE Vince Amey. Released DL Samson Sherrod. SAN DIEGO CHARGERS--Signed LB Steve Tovar. Released CB Damen Wheeler. Agreed to terms with S Rogers Beckett on a four-year contract. NEW YORK GIANTS--Waived FB Brian Aikins. TAMPA BAY BUCCANEERS--Waived FB Jim Kitts.

National Hockey League CAROLINA HURRICANES--Agreed to terms with D Sandis Ozolinsh on a five-year contract. CHICAGO BLACKHAWKS--Re-signed F Michal Grosek to a two-year contract. MINNESOTA WILD--Named Mike Ramsey and Mario Tremblay assistant coaches. Signed D J.J. Daigneault. NEW YORK RANGERS--Agreed to terms with G Johan Holmqvist and G Vitali Yeremeyev. PHOENIX COYOTES--Signed LW Ramzi Abid to a three-year contract.

BOSTON COLLEGE--Named Rob Miller men's tennis coach. CURRY--Named John Ritucci men's tennis coach. GEORGIA SOUTHWESTERN--Named Barry Davis baseball coach. McNEESE STATE--Named Ryan Livengood women's soccer coach. PEPPERDINE--Named Nick Rodionoff women's swimming and diving coach. RHODE ISLAND COLLEGE--Announced the resignation of Scott Perry, baseball coach. ST. JOHN'S, N.Y.--Named Greg Bolitsky men's tennis coach.
